Package org.eclipse.mosaic.lib.routing

Class RoutingParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.mosaic.lib.routing.RoutingParameters
  • public class RoutingParameters
extends Object
    Class containing parameters for route calculation. Gathers parameters in one object.

      • getNumAlternativeRoutes

        public int getNumAlternativeRoutes()

      • alternativeRoutes

        public RoutingParameters alternativeRoutes​(int numAlternativeRoutes)
        Sets the maximum number of alternatives routes to search for between the given start and end point.
        Parameters:
        numAlternativeRoutes - Number of routes which should be found

      • getRoutingCostFunction

        public RoutingCostFunction getRoutingCostFunction()

      • costFunction

        public RoutingParameters costFunction​(RoutingCostFunction routingCostFunction)
        Sets the cost function (e.g. Shortest or Fastest) to use during route building.
        Parameters:
        routingCostFunction - The cost function for route calculation

      • isConsiderTurnCosts

        public boolean isConsiderTurnCosts()
        Returns true if turn costs should be considered during routing.

      • considerTurnCosts

        public RoutingParameters considerTurnCosts​(boolean considerTurnCosts)
        Defines, if turn costs should be considered or not.
        Parameters:
        considerTurnCosts - true if turn costs should be considered, false if turn should be ignored

      • costsForTurnRestriction

        public RoutingParameters costsForTurnRestriction​(double restrictionCosts)
        Defines the costs to apply for turn restrictions. Use Double#POSITIVE_INFINITY to forbid all turn restrictions (recommended).
        Parameters:
        restrictionCosts - the value to apply as costs when a turn is restricted

      • getRestrictionCosts

        public double getRestrictionCosts()

      • vehicleClass

        public RoutingParameters vehicleClass​(VehicleClass vehicleClass)
        Defines the VehicleClass to search a route for (e.g. routing for bicycles differs from car).
        Parameters:
        vehicleClass - Vehicle class for this routing request

      • getVehicleClass

        public VehicleClass getVehicleClass()
